description.message: A chrome extension that notifies your desktop of GitHub web notifications.

preparation_li_1.message: Log in to GitHub with this browser.

preparation_li_2.message: Please turn on notifications to the WEB in the notification settings on the GitHub settings page.

preparation_li_2_li_1.message: This will display notifications on the Notifications page on GitHub

preparation_li_3.message: Please allow the notification settings of this browser in the settings of the computer.

steps_li_2.message: Click the icon on the toolbar and click 'START' from the popup.

steps_li_3.message: Automatically check the notification page while this page is open. (Run every minute) *If you pin it to a tab and keep it small, it will not get in the way.

steps_li_4.message: If there is a new notification, give a desktop notification.

steps_li_5.message: Click on a desktop notification to open the notification page on GitHub.

remarks_li_1.message: Fetching to notification page in the background.

remarks_li_2.message: You don't need to have the GitHub notification page open in your browser.

remarks_li_2_li_1.message: If it is not open, click Desktop Notification to open the Notifications page in a new tab.

remarks_li_2_li_2.message: If it is open, clicking Desktop Notification activates the tab that opens the Notifications page.

remarks_li_3.message: The process ends when this page is closed.

remarks_li_4.message: You can see the processing log in the developer mode console. (press F12)

notes_li_1.message: The check will fail if GitHub, etc., where the check is being performed is in a state that requires re-logging in, but will resume after re-logging in.

notes_li_2.message: If this happens, reload this screen as JavaScript execution may stop, for example, when you restart your PC.

notes_li_3.message: Notifications may not work if the GitHub notification page is redesigned. (I will fix it as soon as I notice it)
